Boulders.Name: Boulder 1
Boulders.Description: This is the obvious large boulder.

Routes.Name: Boot Flake
Routes.Description: Start slightly to the right of the "boot". Gain a right hand crimp and make a big move to the boot. Carefully top out.

Routes.Name: Endo Boy
Routes.Description: This line climbs to the right of Boot Flake via sidepulls and crimps.

Routes.Name: Three Pigs
Routes.Description: Climb the pin scars on the east side of the boulder. Avoiding the scars is a grade or two harder.

Routes.Name: Undercling Problem
Routes.Description: Start at the flake and move into the undercling with slippery feet. Reach over the top for a chipped hold and top out.

Boulders.Name: Slant Rock
Boulders.Description: This boulder is a few yards to the southeast of Boulder 1 and has a low angle west face that is often ascended with no hands.

Boulders.Name: Pump Rock
Boulders.Description: This boulder lies just north of Boulder 1 and has a traverse around its lip

Routes.Name: Pump Traverse
Routes.Description: Stand start at the south-east corner and traverse the        lip of the bouler to the north-west corner and top out. The sit start at the south-east corner is V1 and the sit start at he south-west corner is V2.

Routes.Name: Unnamed
Routes.Description: Climb the north-east arete via a sit start.

Routes.Name: Unknown
Routes.Description: Ascend the face opposite the north face of Pump Rock via sloping crips.

Boulders.Name: Crank Queenie Boulder
Boulders.Description: This boulder is adjacent to the north of Pump Boulder and has a very overhanging north face through the cave.

Boulders.Name: Pile Ups Boulder
Boulders.Description: The obvious short boulder next to the trail.

Routes.Name: Pile Ups Traverse
Routes.Description: Traverse the lip of the boulder left-to-right.

Routes.Name: Pile Driver
Routes.Description: Start at the flake-jug thingy, make a big move up to a sloping crimp and top out via a dyno for the lip or static moves out left.

Routes.Name: Pile Driver Lieback
Routes.Description: Start matched on a good crimp, reach left for the lieback hold, pop for the sloping shelf and make a big move to top out at the apex of the boulder.

Routes.Name: Gomer Pile
Routes.Description: Ascend the face to the right of Pile Driver Lieback.

Routes.Name: Anderson Traverse
Routes.Description: Traverse the face on bad holds left to right starting at the starting hold of Pile Driver.
